subtitle: Cheesy pastry works well in this harvest pudding.

method.text: Sift the flour into a bowl. Rub in the butter until the mixture resembles fine breadcrumbs.
Stir in the cheese, egg yolk and enough cold water to form a smooth but not sticky dough.
Roll a third of the pastry out on a lightly floured surface. Use this to line a 20 cm round pie plate. Prick the base. Chill for 20 min with the remaining pastry.
In a bowl, mix together the prepared apples, blackberries and sugar, reserving a little sugar to sprinkle over the top of the pie. Stir in the cinnamon and hazelnuts.
Sprinkle the rice over the pastry base. Spoon in the fruit mixture. Roll out the remaining pastry and use to top the pie, cutting off any excess.
Stick the edges together with a little cold water then press down well to seal. Flute the edges then roll out any remaining pastry and use to decorate the pie, sealing edges with a little cold water.

Using a sharp knife, make a small cross in the top of the pie to let the steam escape. Brush the whole pie with the beaten egg. Sprinkle over the remaining sugar. Place in the oven for 30 min or until crisp and golden brown. Serve hot or cold in slices.

title: Blackberry, apple and cheese pie
